availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Beall (Logan Co, Ky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Russellville, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Maryland native. Married to Sarah Ann McCuddy Beall in Logan County on August 10, 1830. Father of Sarah Beall, James H. Beall, William Beall, George Beall, Lucy M. Beall Ford, and William Beall. Farmer in Russellville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Logan County in 1850. Farmer in Russellville in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Russellville in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.
